page.title: 16Hemerdon - Galva Road.
page.content: Near the top of Galva Road there was a gateway and path over the moor leading to Hemerdon Mine. The fields on both sides of the road were rough grazing. Plymouth was visible. Further down we saw an old mine chimney and nearby was a large house called Galva House. The fields on either side were now used for crops. We came to a barn that used to house animals but has been converted to garages and belongs to the house across the road. Near it is a grit box to use on icy roads. Then we came to Carthew House and Stert Farm. In the farmyard was farm machinery but it is also a dairy farm. Opposite the farm was an old cottage which is part of Ploughlands Riding Stables. Some children from Sparkwell School go riding there. Julie and Johanna.
